TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDocumentConverterControl

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This interface is obsolete - use the specialized Office services instead for conversions", false)

Docs.summary: This interface is used for exposing settings of document converters to the user.

remarks.para: This interface is implemented by user controls that need to expose settings. The interface scope is specific to document converters in the context of the "Smart Client Authoring" feature. That is, the "document-to-publishing-page" conversion, as opposed to the "document-to-another-document" conversion.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::SPContentType ^ ContentType { Microsoft::SharePoint::SPContentType ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPContentType ^ value); };
member this.ContentType : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPContentType with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content type of the source document for the document converter control.
Docs.value: The content type of the source document for the document converter control.

remarks.para: This property is set before any of the other interface functions are called.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ConverterSettings { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ConverterSettings : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the document converter settings as an XML string.
Docs.value: An XML string that represents the document converter settings.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RequiresConfiguration As Boolean
public: property bool RequiresConfiguration { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that determines whether this document converter requires configuration.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that represents whether this document converter requires configuration.

remarks.para: The document-to-page conversion framework uses this property to query the control and determine if it needs to be configured before running a conversion.
The document content type is already set before this property is called. This property is only called if the ConverterSettings string is empty.

The control should use the settings and the content type to determine whether it needs more user input. If the control returns True when the user clicks OK on the configuration page, the document converter configuration and process are blocked until the document converter control returns False or until the ConverterSettings are no longer empty.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SectionDisplayTitle As String
public: property System::String ^ SectionDisplayTitle { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the section on the page in which this document converter control displays.
Docs.value: Name of the section on the page in which this document converter control displays.

remarks.para: This property references Help UI when the control requires configuration.
